I was trying SO hard to do the most impressive shit Iâ€™ve ever done with tons of self induced pressure... and it honestly wasnâ€™t fun. Two weeks ago, one of the homies asked if I could go over some fundamental groove basics with him. And I have to admit I didnâ€™t really want to (lol) but did it anyway because, you know... friendship.In that session, I slowly started to find the vibe that I had lost through overthinking and analyzing absolutely everything.  It rekindled the fire that I had loved so much about dance in the beginning. The bounce, feeling, and connection to music was flawed, imperfect, but REAL. And all it took was a bit of community, risk, and some honest good-tunes.Itâ€™s still a struggle everyday to find it, but I think what Iâ€™m getting at is even though you see me dancing on social media all the time, or fully curated feeds of finished content... beneath it all Iâ€™m still human. Still trying to figure it all out myself. If youâ€™ve gotten this far, I hope this encourages you in one form or another. Itâ€™s ok to not be at your 100% ALL the time. That itâ€™s alright to take a step back and ask yourself WHY you want to do what you do. Itâ€™s ok to be human.The past few months may have been wack for me... but today, Iâ€™m just about ready to dance another day.
